WRITING.TITLE: b'What\xe2\x80\x99s the most well meaning hurtful thing you\xe2\x80\x99ve been told regarding your transness?'
WRITING.TEXT:
b'Possible trigger for misguided transphobia? But it\xe2\x80\x99s also a discussion- lemme know if I should change the flair. 

Just musing on these things lately looking for camaraderie. It\xe2\x80\x99s that special spot between someone\xe2\x80\x99s most genuine and most misguided, where it hurts not because it\xe2\x80\x99s hateful, but because they mean so well.

The one that sticks with me the most was a coworker/friend who came to me crying after nearly two years of support to tell me that \xe2\x80\x9cGod still saw me as his little girl\xe2\x80\x9d and \xe2\x80\x9c God told me that he can\xe2\x80\x99t stand you desecrating your body, he still loves you, you don\xe2\x80\x99t have to do this to yourself.\xe2\x80\x9d

Again, she was in tears. She felt this with her whole chest. And she meant so well? Can I be angry about it, yeah. Mostly I was just hurt. Just wanted to know if anyone\xe2\x80\x99s had similar experiences.'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT:
b'The consensus is what I\xe2\x80\x99d agree with: Yes, if \xe2\x80\x9cI don\xe2\x80\x99t want to date a trans person\xe2\x80\x9d is in the vocabulary, that\xe2\x80\x99s transphobic. There are tons of ideas for what being trans looks like, plenty of assumptions and stereotypes, but I know for a fact trans (much like any other defining trait in a person) is a spectrum of identity, presentation, and\xe2\x80\x94  I dunno in my opinion, not the most interesting trait about me? I\xe2\x80\x99ve got so much other shit going on. We\xe2\x80\x99re all so cool, are you kidding me that this is your hang up. 

Genital preference imo is a slippery slope. In good faith arguments I can understand it, but if often comes up solely in regards to dating trans people, and once more- there\xe2\x80\x99s a lot us. You\xe2\x80\x99re really assuming that all of our bits are the same?

Personally I\xe2\x80\x99d rather be just. Glad that I like someone enough to date them, whoever they are, but that\xe2\x80\x99s just me. Love is rare, but sure. Narrow the search engine, we don\xe2\x80\x99t wanna date someone with these hang ups anyway. 

TLDR: Yes and no. It\xe2\x80\x99s important to case-by-case when the opinion of \xe2\x80\x9cgenital preference\xe2\x80\x9d comes up, but most people just have a misconception of trans people in general. And if you do- don\xe2\x80\x99t worry, we don\xe2\x80\x99t wanna date you anyway.'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT:
b'It\xe2\x80\x99s okay to have grief for this self. I certainly do. I dream so often about going back to treatment, to suddenly having that security of \xe2\x80\x9cthe thing that consumes my entire life is the thing I now only have to focus on.\xe2\x80\x9d

It\xe2\x80\x99s not that simple anymore. And I can\xe2\x80\x99t stand the way my body has changed. 

But I also know the journey from body hatred is body neutrality. To ask a challenging thought: what can your body do now that it couldn\xe2\x80\x99t before? What are you able to do being a step removed from your eating disorder?

You clearly know what your worst felt like, knowing what it looked like can be really hard. As a last mumble Op, I hear you, I hope you\xe2\x80\x99re doing okay. (If not mostly then in this moment, I hope things are easier.)'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT:
b'Instead of harping on someone clearly in pain and asking her to check herself- let\xe2\x80\x99s remember that in almost of our lives our trans experience was defined by the things that hurt us, rather than the innate joy that being trans is. 
Like of course there is something to be said about the wording, but you can\xe2\x80\x99t tell me that a woman in pain doesn\xe2\x80\x99t take precedence over vocabulary. 

It took me a very long time to find joy in being trans. It was a journey for years defined mostly by pain and struggle, but I was able to find ways to get comfortable in my body pre-and-post transition. I\xe2\x80\x99m lucky, I redefined my experience with gender euphoria rather than the dysphoria that nearly ended my life. 

OP, for a reframe: What if in this life, there is more than this pain? What if through all of this, you are seen as you are, you are able to (if you so choose) to medically transition, what if after all of this you wake up with a comfort and love for who you are?

We can\xe2\x80\x99t be sure what\xe2\x80\x99s at the end of this life or the next, that much is true. You are a woman. You deserve to be seen as who you are. I see you, I\xe2\x80\x99m sorry things are this bad right now, that matters as much as the possibility that this pain ends. Death isn\xe2\x80\x99t a guarantee, it\xe2\x80\x99s a full stop. If you want some resources of trans-friendly crisis lines, please feel free to DM.'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '

I know it can seem scary and overwhelming- and it is- but you are giving yourself the best thing. Years later I will still be chasing the relief that I found in going to treatment for the first time. You deserve this help, and I\xe2\x80\x99m so so proud of you.'

WRITING.TEXT: b'Give it a read if you please. Thanks \xe2\x9d\xa4\xef\xb8\x8f\n\n[Hope, Holes in the World, and Disco Elysium](https://medium.com/@dogffish/hope-holes-in-the-world-disco-elysium-180c8c5a032b)'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT:
b'I\xe2\x80\x99m so sorry that your mother said that to you. That\xe2\x80\x99s so hard to hear. 

Maybe talk with your dietician about this. I know mine previously opened up a line of communication between my parents and her, which took some of the load off of me. Your professional teams should advocate and speak for you. I strongly recommend talking to your team about it and a.) how to process the remarks and b.) how you felt about it, how to explain your efforts without stepping out of your comfort zone. 

I know in my own experience, I never fully went into depth with my parents. They didn\xe2\x80\x99t know, no one knew, but I disclosed sometimes the Current aspects of my treatment. (\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m working on x meal\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x9cMy dietician and I are working on x component\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x9cRight now I\xe2\x80\x99m utilizing y coping strategy to get through x.\xe2\x80\x9d) She\xe2\x80\x99s likely looking for physical progress rather than the mental, and I found enlightening my parents to what that looks like helped eased tensions. 

This by no means is required, I don\xe2\x80\x99t know the relationship you have with your mom, but I hope again you\xe2\x80\x99ll talk to your team about the duress this put on you. 

You\xe2\x80\x99re so strong. I see your effort. It\xe2\x80\x99s real. I\xe2\x80\x99m so proud of you. \xe2\x9d\xa4\xef\xb8\x8f'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT:
b'I was told when my urges come back strong, to \xe2\x80\x9cincrease my support again.\xe2\x80\x9d Be that professional or platonic, online support groups during the day, or what have you. 

You aren\xe2\x80\x99t getting bad again. This is your ED trying to manifest in intense and uncomfortable ways. You\xe2\x80\x99ve fought it before and you will again. The fact you didn\xe2\x80\x99t use any \xe2\x80\x9ccompensating behaviors\xe2\x80\x9d is huge. 

I usually shrink my goalposts when I feel things getting rough.  Celebrate the victories. Take the small things. You also don\xe2\x80\x99t know this girl\xe2\x80\x99s journey either, maybe she\xe2\x80\x99s gone through something similar. Maybe she\xe2\x80\x99s been where you\xe2\x80\x99ve been. It\xe2\x80\x99s in moments like these I try to be the kindest I possibly can with myself, because you are worthy of that kindness and love, especially during this time.'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT:
b'Hard agree with the ginger and peppermint. If you\xe2\x80\x99re cleared for mild exercise, I find a leisurely walk (10-15 mins max) after a meal helps. Hot water bottles help a lot too, just something warm against the part of you that aches. Slow breathing, distracting activities to keep you busy through the worst of it, it\xe2\x80\x99s hard but I promise it\xe2\x80\x99s worth it. 

Wear clothes with stretchy waistlines, loose fitting fabrics, to welcome your shape. Sweatpants were a godsend to me at this time. 

This was the hardest part of treatment for me, believe me I sympathize. You\xe2\x80\x99re going through it and you still *are* and that\xe2\x80\x99s so amazing in itself. 

If it is a comfort, and I\xe2\x80\x99m not sure it is, my own experience with refeeding lead to a slow return to my healthiest weight. I was also still engaging in behaviors at the time. Sending virtual support and love.'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT:
b'To second what\xe2\x80\x99s already been said- yes! It does happen. My time in treatment utterly exhausted me. My ED fought for every scrap it could. That alone left me harrowed. 

It takes effort, but recovery leads to the place where there is not exhaustion, but relief. I know that I was on high alert mid-recovery waiting for the other shoe to drop, and trying to understand myself came with an intense exhaustion in itself. 

Your body is adjusting, and so is your brain and your you. You\xe2\x80\x99re doing the right thing. An electrolyte check can never hurt, but at the very least you\xe2\x80\x99re Heard. I\xe2\x80\x99m super super proud of you.'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT: b'It\xe2\x80\x99s not small and stupid, it\xe2\x80\x99s amazing. Each step is a great stride. I\xe2\x80\x99m so so proud of you, friend. \xf0\x9f\x92\x95'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT:
b'Sometimes sitting in that discomfort is the most powerful thing out there. Think about all the other things you could do if you didn\xe2\x80\x99t purge, remember that these little steps, these discomforts, make it easier in the future to detatch/detangle from your ED. Your ED does not have to control you. It can just be this- just sitting with your parent having a nice conversation. 

To ease symptoms that make me feel the urge to purge, I usually do a leisurely walk after meals, rely on ginger or peppermint tea, sometimes I really just keep myself rooted to the spot with a wheat bag or hot water bottle. 
I actually found a particular video game (Pok\xc3\xa9mon, its Pok\xc3\xa9mon.) keeps me rooted so I can\xe2\x80\x99t \xe2\x80\x9cpurge until I finish this level/battle\xe2\x80\x9d and end up staying longer anyways. These are just things that work for me, though. 

I do hear you though. That feeling is just awful. But you aren\xe2\x80\x99t disgusting. You\xe2\x80\x99re human, and that\xe2\x80\x99a wonderful thing to be.'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT: b'You\xe2\x80\x99ve recognized where the issue is. You\xe2\x80\x99re heard and seen here, but when you can point out these issues I think these are the most important steps. You know this is a step, leaning toward recovery starts by knowing you would feel stronger/better/happier if you were separate from your ED. \n\nThese thoughts can be tamped down with time and redirection. I see you, I hear you, I love you.'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT:
b'Hey, so glad you\xe2\x80\x99re reaching out. Tread lightly on forums like these, but I\xe2\x80\x99m so glad you are in her life trying to assist her best. 

Here are some basic ED-focused to-avoids. It\xe2\x80\x99s not at all extensive and all-encompassing. Everyone has different triggers, but let\xe2\x80\x99s do some simple ones: 

- be mindful of mentioning \xe2\x80\x9cbad\xe2\x80\x9d or \xe2\x80\x9cunhealthy\xe2\x80\x9d foods. for one, there\xe2\x80\x99s no such thing, for two, it puts an unnecessary stigma on certain types of food choices that someone recovering doesn\xe2\x80\x99t really need. 
- do not comment on your friend\xe2\x80\x99s body. it might be changing, that\xe2\x80\x99s okay! that\xe2\x80\x99s also good.
- try to avoid \xe2\x80\x9cweight talk\xe2\x80\x9d, be it someone\xe2\x80\x99s body changing (a friend, a parent trying weight loss, etc) or the time your doctor weighed you. weight is stressful (and does not correlate with your health, BMI is a lie!) and it doesn\xe2\x80\x99t need to be blabbed about. it\xe2\x80\x99s literally like. the least interesting thing to talk about. 
- do not ask direct questions regarding treatment (!!unless your friend brings it up first!!) keep things light unless she invites the conversation. treatment is uncomfortable, it\xe2\x80\x99s raw and tiring. if she brings up passing stories, that\xe2\x80\x99s cool! things like \xe2\x80\x9cso you\xe2\x80\x99re better now?\xe2\x80\x9c or \xe2\x80\x9chow is recovery going?\xe2\x80\x9c can be overwhelming. 

and- if you\xe2\x80\x99re close enough- ask your friend how you can support her. i think it\xe2\x80\x99s particularly hard being asked what you need, but treatment centers do prepare you on average for Knowing things. she might want distracting conversations during meal times. she might want space. she might want someone to talk to, who doesn\xe2\x80\x99t hold her with kid gloves. there are easily things that are harder for her to deal with i didn\xe2\x80\x99t mention- she might ask to not bring up certain foods or health talk, or even just things that seem weird. she wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t ask if it didn\xe2\x80\x99t matter. 

as a final note, you\xe2\x80\x99re a friend, not a counselor. know your boundaries and emotional bandwidth. your friend likely (hopefully) has a team of professionals wiling to talk out the tough stuff. she cares about you too. treat her as you always do, tell her you love her and you support her- give a hug, if she\xe2\x80\x99d like one. take care of yourself first, and the rest can come with it. 

best of luck.'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT:
b'I had issues long before I developed an eating disorder. Things started simple with like, guilt around food. I saw my sibling go through some cycle of disordered eating, and my parents commented on their own bodies a lot. While my sister seemed to gotten better since then, I didn\xe2\x80\x99t forget it. I have memories around 17-19 binging and purging, yet I still had very\xe2\x80\xa6 I dunno, times when I wasn\xe2\x80\x99t focused on my body at all. When I was fine. 

When I hit university I went to the gym more often than I ever had. Then I had a professor talk about committing to my values, and I changed my food lifestyle for good. Which exacerbated my long dormant cycle of guilt surrounding food. I kept at it for about 3 years before I sought ED treatment on my own volition.

I only label this all out to say, I was lucky. I didn\xe2\x80\x99t have family members commenting on my body. I had peripherally disordered eating habits and mindsets, but I later came into my eating disorder on my own. I wasn\xe2\x80\x99t that picky as a kid. Prior to my dietary restrictions, I really had an expansive palate willing to try everything at least once. I\xe2\x80\x99m still gaining that back. I hope I will in time too.'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT:
b'A great reframe could be: People operating in the world as they are is a moot point that it is okay to exist as we are. 

A question to ask ourselves- Is skinny the goal or is it contentment? Is it comfort in our skin? 

I think seeing people moving in the world is beautiful, regardless the arbitrary numbers. I hope you are doing better than when you wrote this. I hope venting a little helped.'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT: b'Yes! You look lovely and I love your piercing!'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT:
b'This is likely due to the constant GI upset. Consider the effect that purging has on your stomach. Both ends are going to be affected by this. I\xe2\x80\x99ve read about people losing the \xe2\x80\x9cgood bacteria\xe2\x80\x9d in your digestive tract and mostly you gotta put something in, be it probiotics via nutrition (yogurt, kombucha, etc) or pills. 

I would recommend, tenderly, that if this is something out of your control to seek professional help. Via a doctor\xe2\x80\x99s appointment for this singular GI issue, or something more focused on the core problems at hand if you are able to seek any sort of treatment. These side effects really stack up to permanent damage: bone loss, people on here have talked about prolapse and needing surgery, organ failure, heart problems, esophagus deterioration. I\xe2\x80\x99m not saying this to scare you, but I also\xe2\x80\xa6 am? You saying it won\xe2\x80\x99t stop you should be frightening to think. I realize EDs really prevent you from thinking rationally, I\xe2\x80\x99m there plenty, but I always benefit from hearing someone else tell me that \xe2\x80\x9chey, that\xe2\x80\x99s not normal, that\xe2\x80\x99s scary, it should be a red flag.\xe2\x80\x9d

Be very, very careful. These sort of \xe2\x80\x9cside effects\xe2\x80\x9d  is not just on top of your behaviors, it is your body raising alarm bells and crying out for help.'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT: b'A huuuge point. Thanks for putting this into words. My thoughts exactly. m'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT: b'Had a mild bike accident. Got what my friend called \xe2\x80\x9ccredit-carded\xe2\x80\x9d by the seat, bruised pretty bad for a few days. \n\nIt\xe2\x80\x99s real. Blunt force can do a number but when it\xe2\x80\x99s directly aimed like that the bruising suuucks.'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT: b'Yea. Still very sensitive down there lol. Not the same but still hurts!'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT:
b'If you have anyone who you can stay close to, I think that for me helps a lot. They don\xe2\x80\x99t have to know the ins and outs. Having company for a meal, or someone to spend some time with helps in times of crisis. 

I\xe2\x80\x99m a big proponent of \xe2\x80\x9cI can\xe2\x80\x99t do x behavior until I do y task,\xe2\x80\x9d but the task is something that lasts a long time. Reorganizing your closet, finishing a 10 episode show. The longer I can stay out of the places where I engage in behaviors the better. Easier said than done, I know. 

From here, harm reduction imo helps for refocusing. Drink something with electrolytes. Eat soft foods, or nutritionally dense, easy to digest meals. (Soups are my friend when I\xe2\x80\x99m particularly spent, miso soup especially.) Drink water. Drink tea. Don\xe2\x80\x99t brush immediately after purging, but do brush your teeth. For some self-love, I recommend nice lotions or a warm shower if that isn\xe2\x80\x99t overwhelming. 

You\xe2\x80\x99re here. You\xe2\x80\x99re going to make it. I\xe2\x80\x99m glad you reached out here.'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT: b'I see you. I\xe2\x80\x99m so glad you\xe2\x80\x99re here!'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT: b'You\xe2\x80\x99re stronger than your urges. It\xe2\x80\x99s good to give yourself nutrients. This isn\xe2\x80\x99t about \xe2\x80\x9cbad\xe2\x80\x9d or \xe2\x80\x9cgood\xe2\x80\x9d food. This is about ensuring you can function through the say. You ate food that you wanted to eat and enjoy, that\xe2\x80\x99s not a bad thing!\n\nTry reframing a little. Distractions of company or a fun video might help get through the worst of it. You got this. I\xe2\x80\x99m glad you reached out. \xf0\x9f\x92\x95 Hang in there.'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT:
b'First off, two months is HUGE! I\xe2\x80\x99m so proud of you!

I will say what my dietician told me in treatment: Things scream louder when they\xe2\x80\x99re dying. 

Your ED is seeing your drive and intentional recovery, and that can lead to thinks like symptom swapping (I didn\xe2\x80\x99t feel the urge to binge until I kept myself from other behaviors, for instance) or these hard spikes in urges. But behaviors don\xe2\x80\x99t mean you haven\xe2\x80\x99t been doing the right thing. 

Recovery is really really hard. I really feel you on that. But I also know that every time you complete a meal, or mindfully partake, or fend off the urge for five extra minutes or ten or a whole evening- you\xe2\x80\x99re beating your ED. It\xe2\x80\x99s hold does get less, and these spikes get less frequent.

It\xe2\x80\x99s also totally natural to feel these maladaptive coping skills come up with things going on in your life. They\xe2\x80\x99ve served you in the past, they just don\xe2\x80\x99t serve you now. Keep doing what you\xe2\x80\x99re doing. Find a new distraction or keep close to someone you trust to ride out the urge wave. You\xe2\x80\x99re going to be okay, success or challenge, you\xe2\x80\x99re going to make it.'

WRITING.TITLE: b'Recovery Takes Everything Out Of Me'
WRITING.TEXT:
b'When I\xe2\x80\x99m committing to recovery like I have been, I find it takes all my energy and focus, just like my ED does. When I\xe2\x80\x99m deep in my Eating Disorder I can\xe2\x80\x99t focus on anything else, but now that I\xe2\x80\x99ve renewed that determination to get better, I feel like I did in treatment. I can\xe2\x80\x99t write or draw. I can\xe2\x80\x99t focus or read. I\xe2\x80\x99m too focused on the moment to moment to reach outside of my ED OR my recovery. 

I know this is necessary. I know this is the path to getting better (I\xe2\x80\x99ve done it before, I know it\xe2\x80\x99s possible) but that doesn\xe2\x80\x99t mean I\xe2\x80\x99m happy with it. When I was in limbo, fighting the ED but allowing it to take up space, I could do other things. Now all my energy is taken up again. 

It\xe2\x80\x99s a weird double standard. If I want my life back (I do, I do) I have to give it just a little bit more. A bit longer. 

I just wanted to know if anyone\xe2\x80\x99s felt this too. 

For those who need some hope: it gets easier. Step by step, over time. You can still slip up but be in recovery. You can still fall but be in the right path. Eventually these decisions to choose nourishment or joy become second nature, even when sometimes they\xe2\x80\x99re hard. It does, it Does get better. It\xe2\x80\x99s just hard sometiems too.'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT:
b'You need nutrition to keep going. I found the shift of \xe2\x80\x9cfood\xe2\x80\x9d to \xe2\x80\x9cnutrition\xe2\x80\x9d altered my thinking a little bit. I know it\xe2\x80\x99s hard. I definitely second something small (I usually suggest something softer on the stomach like soup) and finding someone/something to distract yourself. Watch a movie with someone. Even stay in the same space together, call a friend, watch a youtube video. I also find hot water bottles or heat pads to be really helpful in moments where I\xe2\x80\x99m uncomfortable with the feeling of \xe2\x80\x9cfullness.\xe2\x80\x9d

You got this. And if you slip up, that doesn\xe2\x80\x99t mean you\xe2\x80\x99re done. That means you can try for next time. 

Drink water at least, tea, something with electrolytes. If you can\xe2\x80\x99t keep something down you\xe2\x80\x99re putting yourself at higher and higher risk for more serious situations (heart failure to low electrolytes, stomach acid burning your throat.) bullimia is one of the highest risk eating disorders. Please drink something. This isn\xe2\x80\x99t meant to scare you, but you need to know the risks. 

We\xe2\x80\x99re here. You got this.'

I don\xe2\x80\x99t even talk about it much, if at all, except in specific circles familiar with the struggle, but it still feels like a static film clinging to the rest of me. \n\nTo answer the question: I found that separating my ED even by stating \xe2\x80\x9cmy ED does this\xe2\x80\x9d rather than \xe2\x80\x9cI do this\xe2\x80\x9d makes a difference. This is a hard step and something I struggled with, but in treatment it helped me find myself bit by bit again.  You\xe2\x80\x99re not your eating disorder, you\xe2\x80\x99re affected by it. You struggle with it, but it isn\xe2\x80\x99t you. It wants to be, but it can\xe2\x80\x99t be. You have interests and hobbies and loves. You have people in your life or music you like. WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT:
b'It is natural for this, to a degree, to feel good. It\xe2\x80\x99s a coping mechanism that has been engineered to give us a specific Thing (feelings of control, relief, it varies person to person- and a helpful question to understanding your ED as to What it is giving you, or what it is trying to give you) 

I think for me the guilt and pain come after. We know, I feel as though if you\xe2\x80\x99re in this r/ you kind of, Know, that this is not good. It is not something to protect us in the long term, and has far more consequences than benefits. We know this, and we still do it, and for me that acknowledgement is where the \xe2\x80\x9cbad\xe2\x80\x9d comes. 

Also, let\xe2\x80\x99s be honest- purging I would say does not \xe2\x80\x9cfeel\xe2\x80\x9d good. The act thereof kind of sucks, but the after effects come with a boost of brain chemicals. There\xe2\x80\x99s science in this, others have pointed it out, addictive properties to the act/ritual/routine that has served a purpose in the past.

TLDR: It feels good not because it \xe2\x80\x9cis\xe2\x80\x9d good, but because this is a disorder that affects and changes your brain chemistry. It is easy to love what is given you, and by proxy what you have to do to get it. It\xe2\x80\x99s the definition of addiction.'

b'I mean, I don\xe2\x80\x99t know, but assuming their professional background they\xe2\x80\x99re aware of most tricks in the book. If you tell them (or if you don\xe2\x80\x99t) they just want information that is going to help them plan the best treatment for you possible. Recovery looks different for everyone, it\xe2\x80\x99s all highly individualized. 
And to note, most professionals in this field I\xe2\x80\x99ve found have an experience with it directly. They\xe2\x80\x99ve been where you\xe2\x80\x99ve been, where you are, I mean. They kinda know how sneaking around works.

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT: b'I went through PP. Very kind. Well meaning, genuinely such a great experience. Two trips and I had my vial. I will say that they are *extremely* hard to get a hold of in some areas, so while you can certainly get the prescription through them I would try to get involved with another practice once you get established. Been on T for 5 years and I still have to pull teeth to get that prescription renewed (often in person appointments that I called for 3 weeks to get an answer, any answer. Leaving a message leads me nowhere.) There are two PPs in my immediate area and both are like this. Just a lot of demand and not enough support. And doctors in my area were super transphobic and unwilling, they were my only lifeline which I am grateful for- but they do do this unfortunately.\n\nTLDR: More doctors will be more comfortable prescribing HRT after you get established to the best of my knowledge. PP has Informed Consent to make the route to medical transition possible, but they are hard to get a hold of in some areas. Best of luck!!'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '

I\xe2\x80\x99m not going to say that Treatment Will Change You, treatment was one of the hardest things I\xe2\x80\x99ve ever done, but it does show you how to rewire that circuit in your brain that needs that control. It helps. The first day I didn\xe2\x80\x99t exhibit any symptoms, the first week? It\xe2\x80\x99s a freedom and a *control* I thought I\xe2\x80\x99d never see again. \n\nHoping the best for you. WRITING.TITLE: b' '

b'If therapy doesn\xe2\x80\x99t help, you\xe2\x80\x99re not into it or you\xe2\x80\x99re with the wrong therapist. Multiple types of therapy exist, and it doesn\xe2\x80\x99t have to be 1x1, there\xe2\x80\x99s group therapy, there\xe2\x80\x99s support groups in general.

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT: b'It\xe2\x80\x99s real. It ebbs and flows, but it\xe2\x80\x99s always here. \n\nThis world is scary but by god I will carve out a corner filled up with the things I love. It\xe2\x80\x99s real.'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT: b'How many adults aren\xe2\x80\x99t. They\xe2\x80\x99re petty and dance around hard topics and getting straight answers from people can be really difficult. WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT:
b'That\xe2\x80\x99s tough. I will say that any process of medical transition can and Will cause doubts and concerns. After surgery people often talk about how there\xe2\x80\x99s a guilt to \xe2\x80\x9cputting your body through this.\xe2\x80\x9d I will say for a lot (if not most) that concern passes after a while. Doesn\xe2\x80\x99t mean this isn\xe2\x80\x99t real, or hard. 

Honestly it depends on your comfort with yourself. I come to this crossroads a lot lately myself, and I usually stick with \xe2\x80\x9cconsistent but low levels of prescribed hormone,\xe2\x80\x9d but that\xe2\x80\x99s just what works for me. 

Maybe you want essentially a \xe2\x80\x9cmaintenance dose.\xe2\x80\x9d That said, 3 months in means there\xe2\x80\x99s a Lot of changes that still need to go underway before you\xe2\x80\x99re at equilibrium. 
If you\xe2\x80\x99re concerned about sperm production, maybe look into sperm donor banks? I know some can freeze/analyze your sperm count, but bio-straps are not my area of expertise. Definitely touch base with them, but if it is any comfort 3 months of HRT shouldn\xe2\x80\x99t blast your sperm count. Not that intensely. 

Bottom line, you\xe2\x80\x99re a woman. You\xe2\x80\x99re going to be a woman with or without medical transition. You\xe2\x80\x99re gonna be okay.'

WRITING.TEXT: b'Yeah, I\xe2\x80\x99m gonna go and say that it\xe2\x80\x99s not kind, whatever she\xe2\x80\x99s doing. Definitely be straightforward with Her. She\xe2\x80\x99s hurting you, inadvertently or not. Either she\xe2\x80\x99s scared of commitment or isn\xe2\x80\x99t trying to, and wants to keep you interested. Either way, you deserve a love that treasures your company as a PERSON rather than just a plaything. You deserve better, and she might deserve a therapist.'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT:
b'Honestly it\xe2\x80\x99s hard for me to enjoy Disney franchises nowadays. I can only see the obvious monetization versus making a cool Unique Idea outside of a framework they know makes money. 

And the military propaganda.

I used to like them, don\xe2\x80\x99t get me wrong, and funnily enough I still enjoy pieces (most notably the number of now-shut Netflix series) frankly 30 million dollar movie budgets don\xe2\x80\x99t exist in a world that takes care of people and the environment. It\xe2\x80\x99s a moral stance I took, but I also understand it\xe2\x80\x99s not everyone\xe2\x80\x99s.'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT: b'Aight, that stated: fuck him. Get out of there. If he doesn\xe2\x80\x99t are (and it\xe2\x80\x99s okay if it hurts) but you more than certainly do not need that sort of maltreatment. I\xe2\x80\x99m so sorry he said that, the hell.'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT: b'Yes, but *straps.* Whatever your poison I think there\xe2\x80\x99s something for everyone.'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT:
b'I would also question an aversion to trans people. The reasons speak to validity, but I know I felt a certain way for a long time and then flipped because, I don\xe2\x80\x99t want to have to explain my Transgender Existence to a cis person. I don\xe2\x80\x99t think cis people can understand the nuances of trans people (especially anyone outside of the binary) and I\xe2\x80\x99ve gotten tired of feeling like I need to justify myself to cis folks. (Not a cis-bash, just stating opinions here.)

But I digress. Attraction is attraction, but I\xe2\x80\x99d also ask myself what about someone\xe2\x80\x99s gender journey strikes a dull chord. (Why do I want to forget my trans identity, why is it that trans experiences drain me, do I not want to validate another trans person\xe2\x80\x99s experience? do I feel that a cis person has to validate my experience- why? what is it in myself that I don\xe2\x80\x99t want to see reflected in another trans person?) Those sorts of things. That doesn\xe2\x80\x99t mean break up with your partner or w/e, find who makes you warm and keep em close! And by no means am I attempting to be accusatory. These are questions I have asked myself. I just always, always question those thoughts when they came up. I dunno about you but I was raised pretty hardcore in gender roles. Lotta research, lot of growth. 

That said about T- yeah. T gave me a weird relationship with sex, I definitely struggle with it a lot. You\xe2\x80\x99re not alone there. If ace is the shoe that fits by all means use it. Sex-neutrality or sex-positive ace folks also exist, so welcome if that feels your vibe!'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT:
b'Yeah, nah. I couldn\xe2\x80\x99t. I\xe2\x80\x99ve been there and done that. When people hit this point I personally have come to the conclusion that I don\xe2\x80\x99t need to \xe2\x80\x9cchange them,\xe2\x80\x9d and more importantly it is Their job to do the work and research to figuring out their shit. 

If you want to be direct, a text stating your feelings and why you don\xe2\x80\x99t want to spend time with someone invalidating your entire experience. You *could* give them a chance and point out your history together, or you could just state how you feel and close that door. 

I\xe2\x80\x99m personally a painful \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m antsy if a door is left open so I slam it on my way out\xe2\x80\x9d but that is not the way you have to live your life. 

For what it\xe2\x80\x99s worth: I\xe2\x80\x99m sorry. You are exactly who you are, and that demands worth and respect. Tread light.'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT:
b'Here\xe2\x80\x99s the cool thing about sexuality- it\xe2\x80\x99s whatever you like. It\xe2\x80\x99s fluid. It can lean one way or another and the labels that feel comfortable to you are the ones that you should use. If that\xe2\x80\x99s straight or \xe2\x80\x9cheteroflexible\xe2\x80\x9d or \xe2\x80\x9cI dunno, people are cute\xe2\x80\x9d that\xe2\x80\x99s fine too.

As a reminder, liking men who are \xe2\x80\x9cfeminine\xe2\x80\x9d is still liking men. Maybe you just have a type. I just know \xe2\x80\x9cfemboys\xe2\x80\x9d can be a bit of a charged term in some circles. You\xe2\x80\x99re by all means allowed to find them attractive, but not everyone people consider a femboy calls themselves one, y\xe2\x80\x99know?

You can experiment too. Even if you just poke around in online circles calling yourself bisexual or pansexual, or straight! You are under no obligation to have yourself figured out. I have yet to meet someone who does.'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT: b'It\xe2\x80\x99s normal! We notice when people are attractive (through societal standards, but beauty conventions is a whole conversation) it\xe2\x80\x99s perfectly normal. You are perfectly fine looking at attractive people and telling them they\xe2\x80\x99re attractive. Guys don\xe2\x80\x99t hype each other up enough.'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT:
b'Friend, you have survived a tremendous amount. You do not have to feel selfish or guilty. Any mental health issue is sometimes like operating with blinders. Anxiety makes it hard for me to see logical solutions, or overthink the simple. Brains are fickle, tricky things.  There are many things that a sick brain tells us, so many of them are lies. You aren\xe2\x80\x99t foolish or guilty, you didn\xe2\x80\x99t know. You could not have seen the answes around you given your situation. People who cared for you showed up when you needed them. You don\xe2\x80\x99t *owe* them anything, you are here. For them, clearly, that is enough.

As someone who had survived a number of paltry attempts, much without the knowledge of my loved ones, it\xe2\x80\x99s okay. It\xe2\x80\x99s okay, and I\xe2\x80\x99m so glad you had people to support you through the aftermath. (Because regardless or not the intent an accident like that IS trauma, attempts ARE trauma. You are a damn champion for writing this out.)

Happy you\xe2\x80\x99re sticking around longer. There\xe2\x80\x99s a lot in this world to look forward to. And that\xe2\x80\x99s where you are- forward! Learning as you go, leaving the past behind to carve a better future.'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT:
b'Agreed with the most of the ppl here. If you\xe2\x80\x99re part of the club, feel free to rib/etc, if not- their intonation to the comment speaks a lot to get off of. (Are they anticipating a response, is it spoken neutrally/warmly/negatively, is it a one off comment or a topic they wish to discuss?) Mostly, I mind my own. This is one of those topics I believe that if you\xe2\x80\x99re not in the same club, it\xe2\x80\x99s time to take a backseat and listen. 

Given the situation, you could also ask what they need. \xe2\x80\x9cDo you want support or an ear?\xe2\x80\x9d If it\xe2\x80\x99s just a one off, let them define themselves how they see fit. If that\xe2\x80\x99s the word they use out of self-love. Sure. Hype em\xe2\x80\x99 up. everyone\xe2\x80\x99s body is their own business. I don\xe2\x80\x99t ever think that it\xe2\x80\x99s really appropriate to comment on someone\xe2\x80\x99s body.

\xe2\x80\x9cAnd I love you\xe2\x80\x9d is not always the take (you don\xe2\x80\x99t love them \xe2\x80\x9cin spite\xe2\x80\x9d of their fatness, do you? Then maybe it\xe2\x80\x99s not appropriate.)'

Admitting this is new is not bad or scary. Most people I know are into their twenties and haven\xe2\x80\x99t gone on a date. You got this dude. So excited for you.'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT: b'You go on. It\xe2\x80\x99s the only way. Center your belief in the notion that you are worthy (even if worth is something you struggle with, because everyone struggles with it) of something else, something more, and you go on. Slowly, surely, step by step. Forgiveness doesn\xe2\x80\x99t come easy, but (I believe, I hope) comes eventually. You don\xe2\x80\x99t need to forgive yourself to start healing. In my experience, you start healing to someday forgive yourself. \n\nI love you. I hope you\xe2\x80\x99re okay.'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '

(I\xe2\x80\x99m a Gen Z/Millennial \xe2\x80\x9ccusp\xe2\x80\x9d if you will. Please know I\xe2\x80\x99m not saying this to be rude!)'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT:
b'hey there! i\xe2\x80\x99m a nonbinary student. i transferred here last year and my experience has been well enough. for starters gender inclusive housing is available, and in certain halls (the new jennings hall for instance) bathrooms are self-enclosed so you don\xe2\x80\x99t have to worry about indecent exposure. in the dorming portals there is no way to indicate if someone will be open to rooming with lgbtq+ students, so that for me was trial and error. i eventually DID find a roommate and we get along extraordinarily well, but if you\xe2\x80\x99d rather have a room by yourself or with someone better aligned to your identity- that\xe2\x80\x99s something especially available as of recent. 

on the application, they changed \xe2\x80\x9cgender\xe2\x80\x9d back to one\xe2\x80\x99s \xe2\x80\x9csex\xe2\x80\x9d for students. which is sort of a backstep imo. there\xe2\x80\x99s effort, but it often can come off as well-intended but poorly executed.

there are clubs around: Shades of Pride, QUEST, SOGIE, Madison Equality are all readily available and wonderful. However, in my experiences in my major of study I\xe2\x80\x99m entirely outnumbered by cis people. the campus is primarily white, a little overwhelmingly so, and often not intentionally bigoted, but ignorant. i\xe2\x80\x99ve had issues of transphobia with students (never with professors, though) and i do not feel comfortable outing myself in most circles. simply put from my own experience: the staff try, if they know. the student body themselves are not one i put a lot of faith in. 

due to my own introversion and discombobulated state (mostly due to the college atmosphere in general) i didn\xe2\x80\x99t spend a lot of time in the aforementioned clubs, but i can tell you the time i spent there was valuable. i believe places like shades of pride and QUEST and all of the above are entirely necessary. they\xe2\x80\x99re open and welcoming and the counseling center has also been warm to lgbtq+ students.

through my own wariness of the College Experience, i\xe2\x80\x99ll say tread lightly. there are some incredible staff members dedicating to helping (the associate dean of admissions, joe, comes to mind. he was so helpful for me moving forward, as well as jennifer iwerks who helps run SOGIE.) but you really have to find your niche. i wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t call jmu a diverse community, and certainly not a wildly liberal college overall, but there are people in the right places. you simply have to work to find them. 

hope this helps. :-)'
